surveysd 0.1.0
  • Reference

Calculate point estimates for weights and bootstrap weights

Source: R/aggregateReplicates.R
aggregateReplicates.Rd

Calculate an estimate for each group and each bootstrap replicate of survey weights. The replicate weihgts are assumed to be in wide format as returned by recalib and draw.bootstrap

aggregateReplicates(dat, FUN, groupVars = NULL, weights = attr(dat,
  "weights"), b.weights = attr(dat, "b.rep"))

Arguments

dat

A data.table containing bootstrap weights. This will usually be the output of recalib or draw.bootstrap.
FUN

An aggregation function as returned by WeightedMean, WeightedMedian, WeightedSum, WeightedRatio and WeightedSize.
groupVars

Column names in dat refering to grouping variables. Typically, those columns are factors or integers
weights

Column names for the survey weights
b.weights

Column names for the boostrap weights

Examples

eusilc <- surveysd:::demo.eusilc()
dat_boot <- draw.bootstrap(eusilc, REP = 10, hid = "db030", weights = "rb050",
                           strata = c("db040"), period = "year")
dat_boot_calib <- recalib(dat_boot, conP.var = c("rb090", "age"), conH.var = c("db040", "hsize"))
#> Convergence reached in  4  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  5  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  6  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  4  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  5  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  4  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  4  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  3  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  4  steps 
#> Convergence reached in  4  steps 

## poverty rate for each year
aggregateReplicates(dat_boot_calib, WeightedRatio("povmd60 == 1"), c("year"))
#>    year     rb050        w1        w2        w3        w4        w5        w6

## mean income for each year and gender
aggregateReplicates(dat_boot_calib, WeightedMean("py010n", na.rm = TRUE), c("year", "rb090"))
#>     year  rb090   rb050      w1      w2      w3      w4      w5      w6      w7
